Description: TRAIN 200 IMPOVERISHED YOUTH IN VARIOUS INCOME GENERATING PROJECTS. LACK OF EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES HAVE RESULTED INCREASED CRIME AS THEY STRUGGLE TO FIND A SOURCE OF INCOME. THE GRANT WILL FIGHT POVERTY THROUGH VARIOUS INCOME GENERATING PROJECTS.
TRAIN AND EQUIP YOUTH AND WOMEN WITH VOCATIONAL TECHNICAL SKILLS IN GARMENT MAKING AND WOODWORK. THE GRANT WILL IMPROVE THE LIVELIHOODS OF YOUTHS AND WOMEN THROUGH CREATION OF INDIVIDUAL ENTERPRISES.

JEDIDIAH TRUST WILL DRILL A BOREHOLE AND INSTALL A DRIP IRRIGATION SYSTEM AND ESTABLISH A MARKET AND NUTRITION GARDEN.  THE GRANT WILL IMPROVE THE FOOD SECURITY AND NUTRITION OF CHILDREN OF INCARCERATED PARENTS AND THEIR CAREGIVERS.

TRAIN WOMEN IN HANDICRAFT AND BEADWORK MAKING. THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC RESULTED IN INCREASED UNEMPLOYMENT RATES WHICH LED TO AN INCREASE IN INCIDENCES OF GENDER-BASED VIOLENCE.  TO ADDRESS GENDER INEQUALITY AND IMPROVED LIVELIHOODS.

ENTREPRENEURSHIP TRAINING BASED ON SELF-HELP, SOCIAL CAPITAL, CAPACITY BUILDING, LOCAL OWNERSHIP, AND FINANCIAL SUPPORT. THE GRANT WILL ASSIST IN CREATING OR ENHANCING GROUP OR INDIVIDUAL ENTERPRISES; FACILITATE ACCESS TO CREDIT; ESTABLISH MARKET LINKAGE

ESTABLISHMENT OF A BANANA PLANTATION AND PRODUCTION IN TONGOGARA REFUGEE CAMP. THIS WILL INCREASE LIVELIHOOD SECURITY AND REDUCE DEPENDENCY ON DONOR AGENCIES IN THE CAMP. INCORPORATION OF 20 HOST COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL RESULT IN PEACEFUL CO-EXISTENCE.
BOREHOLE DRILLING AND ESTABLISHMENT OF CLIMATE SMART AGRICULTURE. PROVIDE TRAININGS ON SUSTAINABLE AND NUTRITION-BASED AGRICULTURE AND PRESERVATION OF DROUGHT RESISTANT SEED VARIETIES.

THIS GRANT WILL IMPROVE THE INCOME, INCREASE FOOD SECURITY, AND NUTRITION OF FAMILIES OF CHILDREN WITH DISABILITIES THROUGH THE ESTABLISHMENT OF SUSTAINABLE INCOME GENERATING PROJECTS SUCH AS MARKET GARDENING, POULTRY REARING, PEANUT BUTTER PROCESSING, A

TARIRO FOUNDATION WILL INCREASE INCOME LEVELS OF THE BENEFICIARIES AND HELP THE FAMILIES OF PEOPLE LIVING WITH DISABILITIES MOVE FROM DEPENDING ON HANDOUTS TO BEING SELF-RELIANT BY PARTICIPATING IN VARIOUS INCOME-GENERATING PROJECTS.
TO EMPOWER INTELLECTUALLY DISABLED ADOLESCENTS AND ADULTS BY PROVIDING A RELEVANT AND INCLUSIVE EDUCATION THAT PREPARES THEM FOR EMPLOYMENT AND INDEPENDENCE WITHIN THE COMMUNITY.
THIS GRANT WILL INCREASE FOOD SECURITY, ACCESS TO CLEAN SAFE WATER, DIVERSE SOURCES OF HOUSEHOLD INCOME AND WOMEN EMPOWERMENT THROUGH THE DRILLING AND INSTALLATION OF TWO BUSH PUMP BOREHOLES.
TO PROVIDE INCOME GENERATING SUPPORT THROUGH FISH FARMING AND NUTRITION GARDENS THAT WILL IMPROVE BASIC ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL CONDITIONS AT THE COMMUNITY LEVEL FOR VULNERABLE CHILDREN AT THE ECD LEVEL.
TO PROVIDE SAFE DRINKING WATER FOR HOUSEHOLDS AND LIVESTOCK IN UMGUZA THROUGH BOREHOLE DRILLING AND ESTABLISHMENT OF AN INCOME GENERATING NUTRITION GARDEN.
MEN 4 EQUALITY WILL BREAK THE POVERTY CYCLE BY PROVIDING GOATS TO MALE HEADS OF HOUSEHOLDS.  THE INCOME GENERATED FROM THE GOATS WILL BE USED TO EMPOWER GIRLS THROUGH EDUCATION.
TO IMPROVE THE WELFARE OF CHILDREN LIVING WITH DISABILITIES AT MUREWA PRIMARY AND MUREWA HIGH SCHOOLS DISABILITY RESOURCE UNITS THROUGH LIFE SKILLS TRAINING AND FISH FARMING.
THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE IN INSTALLING A DRIP IRRIGATION SYSTEM AND WATER SOURCE.
THE MAIN OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE SAFE CLEAN PORTABLE DRINKING WATER TO OUR VULNERABLE COMMUNITY OF KAMUKWESUKENI COMMUNITY WHICH CAN SUPPORT CHICKEN REARING.
THE PLANNED ACTIVITY IS POULTRY PRODUCTION, UTILIZING PROFITS FROM THE ACTIVITY TO SUPPLEMENT INCOMES OF THE ORGANIZATION'S MEMBERS.
THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDS TO BUILD A SHELTER TO KEEP CLINIC VISITORS OUT OF THE ELEMENTS. PEOPLE CURRENTLY MEET UNDER A TREE.
THIS PROJECT WILL RAISE AND SELL POULTRY FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE ORGANIZATION MEMBERS AND LOCAL COMMUNITY.
THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT A POULTRY OPERATION DESIGNED TO ASSIST VULNERABLE POPULATIONS. FUNDS WILL PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL FUNDS FOR MEMBERS CHILDREN AND MICROLOANS.
THIS PROJECT WILL FUND THE PURCHASE OF DESKS FOR STUDENTS.
THIS PROJECT WAS CREATED TO CONSTRUCT AN INCINERATOR FOR MEDICAL WASTE FROM THE ON SITE CLINIC.
THE GRANTEE UNDER THIS PROJECT WILL RAISE POULTRY FOR SALE TO THE LOCAL COMMUNITY, PROVIDING NUTRITIONAL SUPPORT FOR THE LOCAL COMMUNITY AND FUNDS FROM THE SALE OF POULTRY FOR MEMBER SUPPORT.
THIS PROJECT WILL FUND THE PURCHASE OF MATERIALS TO STOCK A LIBRARY INCLUDING TABLES, CHAIRS, SHELVES AND BOOKS.
THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT VULNERABLE POPULATIONS THROUGH THE SALE OF POULTRY. PROFITS FROM THE SALE OF POULTRY WILL BE DISTRIBUTED TO MEMBERS OF THE COOPERATIVE.
POULTRY PRODUCTION TO BENEFIT EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES FOR ORPHANS AND OTHER VULNERABLE CHILDREN.
PROCUREMENT OF BROILER POULTRY, FEED AND EQUIPMENT TO SUPPLEMENT THE FOOD SUPPLY IN THE VILLAGE.
TO CONSTRUCT A TENNIS COURT, VOLLEYBALL/NETBALL COURT AT NGCULWINI THROUGH WHICH THE CLUB WILL UNEARTH HIDDEN TALENT ON THE YOUTH AND CONTRIBUTE IN INSPIRING A NATION OF DREAM CHASERS THROUGH SPORTS.
TO DRILL AND INSTALL AN ELECTRIC BOREHOLE FOR THE SCHOOL TO ACCESS CLEAN AND  RUNNING WATER.
TO ESTABLISH AN AGRICULTURE TRAINING HUB FARM AND NURSERY  AT ELANGENI WHICH WILL BENEFIT OVER 100 GROUPS OF UNEMPLOYED WOMEN AND GIRLS IN THE COUNTRY, IN THE NEXT THREE YEARS
TO CONSTRUCT 8 TOILETS TO IMPROVE HEALTH AND SANITATION IN THE SCHOOL
TO PROCURE EQUIPMENT AND MATERIALS FOR THE BEE KEEPING PROJECT AND TO  PROVIDE EDUCATION TO EXISTING AND NEW LOCAL BEEKEEPERS AND HONEY GATHERERS ON THE CORRECT METHODS OF BEE KEEPING
PROCURE 50 DESKS AND 50 CHAIRS FOR THE SCHOOL TO ENHANCE TEACHING AND LEARNING.
TO CONSTRUCT 12 TOILETS FOR THE SCHOOL WHICH WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE OVERALL HEALTH AND SANITATION OF THE SCHOOL AND  THE COMMUNITY AT LARGE.
TO RENOVATE A BLOCK OF 3 CLASSROOMS THAT WAS DAMAGED BY THE STORM.
TO DRILL AND INSTALL AN ELECTRIC BOREHOLE FOR THE SCHOOL TO HAVE ACCESS TO CLEAN RUNNING WATER.
TO DRILL AND INSTALL A SOLAR PUMP BOREHOLE FOR SIGCINENI COMMUNITY
PROCURE 100 SINGLE DESKS AND 100 CHAIRS FOR THE SCHOOL
COMPLETION OF A BLOCK OF 3 CLASSROOMS
TO ASSIST THE COMMUNITY WITH RE-GRAVELLING A 1 KM STRETCH ROAD THAT HAS BEEN DAMAGED BY CYCLONE LOUISE
TO PURCHASE AND INSTALL A 173 557 LITRES STEEL WATER TANK TO HARVEST WATER FOR A BETTER SUPPLY FOR EMBO COMMUNITY
TO ESTABLISH AN AGRI BUSINESS INCOME GENERATIVE PROJECT FOR WOMEN AND GIRLS OF NTSHAKABILI COMMUNITY IN THE HHOHHO REGION.
TO CONSTRUCT 4 PIT LATRINES AND 2 HAND WASHING BASINS FOR ZAMANI PRIMARY SCHOOL
TO DRILL AND INSTALL AN ELECTRIC BOREHOLE WITHIN THE SCHOOL

TO PURCHASE MATERIALS TO RENOVATE THE COMMUNITY STRUCTURE, TO PAVE VOLLEYBALL/NETBALL/BASKETBALL COURT AND TO CONSTRUCT TWO PIT LATRINES THAT WILL BE USED BY THE COMMUNITY IN PARTICULAR,  YOUTH AND WOMEN FOR JOB AND LIFE SKILLS TRAINING .
TO PURCHASE CONSUMER SCIENCE LABORATORY SEWING EQUIPMENT.
TO REACH LOW-INCOME WOMEN AND GIRLS IN MAHLANGATSHA INKHUNDLA, AS WELL AS THEIR COMMUNITIES, WITH MENSTRUAL SUPPLIES AND MENSTRUAL HEALTH AND HYGIENE EDUCATION
THE OMAKANGE COMMUNITY GARDEN WILL PURCHASE FARMING SUPPLIES AND SEEDS TO EXPAND PRODUCE PRODUCTION OF AN EXISTING COMMUNITY GARDEN.
PROJECT WILL PURCHASE FARMING SUPPLIES AND REHABILITATE AN EXISTING BOREHOLE IN ORDER TO ESTABLISH A GARDEN THAT WILL PROVIDE FRESH PRODUCE TO THE COMMUNITY.
PROVISION OF HIPPO WATER ROLLERS FOR TRANSPORTATION OF WATER FOR HOUSEHOLD USE FROM COMMUNAL WATER TAPS.
PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION OF SOLAR ENERGY UNITS TO PROVIDE LIGHTING TO RURAL HOMES AND PREVENT WILD ANIMALS FROM KILLING LIVESTOCK DURING THE NIGHT.
TO PROVIDE A FENCE FOR A SCHOOL TO INCREASE SECURITY FOR PUPILS AND STAFF

TO PROVIDE A SOLAR POWERED PUMP TO PIPE WATER TO A COOPERATIVE FARMING AREA BENEFITING SMALL SCALE FARMERS.

THIS PROJECT WILL CONSTRUCT A LATRINE WITH CHANGING ROOMS FOR GIRLS AND A WATER HARVEST STAND WITH A 5,000 UPVC LITER CAPACITY TANK AT THE NABIRYE PRIMARY SCHOOL.

THE PROJECT WILL CONSTRUCT A FIVE-STANCE LATRINE, TWO WASHROOMS AND INSTALL A 10,000-LITER WATER TANK FOR HARVESTING CLEAN DRINKING WATER AND PROVIDE WASH SUPPLIES TO PREVENT THE OUTBREAK OF COMMUNICABLE DISEASES AND COVID-19 IN PWDS AND ELDERY PERSONS
THIS PROJECT WILL CONSTRUCT FOUR 10,000-LITER RAINWATER HARVESTING TANKS FOR THE COMMUNITIES OF NABUNGA, KIZIBA AND KYALULANGIRA IN RAKAI DISTRICT.
THIS PROJECT WILL CONSTRUCT A THREE-STANCE DRAINABLE LATRINE, AND A WASHROOM FOR GIRLS AT THE KATENG PRIMARY SCHOOL, KADUNGULU TOWN COUNCIL IN SERERE DISTRICT.
THIS PROJECT WILL INSTALL A SOLAR-POWERED BOREHOLE FOR POTABLE WATER SUPPLY AND PURCHASE MATERIALS TO BUILD A TREE SEEDLING NURSERY AND A VEGETABLE GARDEN.
THIS PROJECT WILL CONSTRUCT FIVE PROTECTED SPRING-FED WELLS IN THE OMOLADYANG PARISH WITH THE GOAL OF INCREASING ACCESS TO SAFE WATER AND BASIC SANITATION.

TO DEVELOP, TEST AND SUCCESSFULLY DEMONSTRATE A REPLICABLE MODEL FOR HYGIENE EDUCATION, WATER SUPPLY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SANITATION IN RURAL PRIMARY SCHOOLS, BUILDING ON THE PAST COLLABORATION EXPERIENCES IN SCHOOL SANITATION.
THIS PROJECT WILL CONSTRUCT FIVE (5) WELLS IN FIVE (5) SEPARATE VILLAGES IN THE NAMUTUMBA DISTRICT.

THIS PROJECT CONSISTS OF BUILDING TWENTY 20 3X4 METER PIG PENS, IN WHICH THE BENEFICIARIES ARE WIDOWS WHO LOST THEIR HUSBANDS DUE TO HIV/AIDS AND WILL PROVIDE ECONOMIC GROWTH AND EMPOWERMENT FOR THESE WOMEN.
THIS PROJECT WILL FUND THE PROCUREMENT OF FORTY OX DRIVEN PLOWS AND RELATED EQUIPMENT FOR COMMUNITY BASED WOMENS GROUPS.
THIS PROJECT WILL INITIATE A LOCALLY BASED HANDICRAFT BUSINESS CENTER OPERATED BY WOMEN THAT SERVES AS WORKPLACE, TRADING POINT AND INCUBATOR OF HANDICRAFT IDEAS.
THIS PROJECT IS AN ECONOMIC EMPOWERMENT PROGRAM TARGETING WOMEN IN NYABIKUKU VILLAGE.
THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE THE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT OF FEMALE STUDENTS BY INCREASING ACCESS TO WASH AND MENSTRUAL HYGIENE MANAGEMENT IN TWO SCHOOLS IN NAMAYINGO DISTRICT.
THIS PROJECT WILL HELP ESTABLISH TWO CERVICAL CANCER SCREENING CENTERS IN JINJA DISTRICT.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT VULNERABLE WOMEN AND THEIR FAMILIES IN PATEBANA MASIMBONG COMMUNITY, PAKI-MASAMBONG CHIEFDOM, THROUGH BANANA AND PLANTAIN VALUE-ADDING ACTIVITIES, TO PROVIDE GREATER OPPORTUNITIES FOR INCOME GENERATION.

TO INCREASE ON HOUSEHOLD INCOMES OF 2000 RURAL WOMEN AND YOUTHS FOR FOOD SECURITY AND SUSTAINABILITY OF FARMERS THROUGH TREE CROPS REHABILITATION (COCOA & COFFEE), VEGETABLE GARDEN, AND INLAND VALLEY SWAMP RICE DEVELOPMENT FOR LIVELIHOOD SUPPORT.

THE SENEGALESE ASSOCIATION OF MINE VICTIMS (ASVM) WAS FOUNDED IN 1999 BY A GROUP OF LANDMINES SURVIVORS & HAS GROWN TO OVER 400 MEMBERS. ASVM REPRESENTS NEARLY HALF OF ALL THE LANDMINE SURVIVORS IN SENEGAL & ADVOCATES FOR THE REMOVAL OF LANDMINE.

THE SAINT MICHEL SOCIAL CENTER (CSSM) IS A CATHOLIC NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION IN SAINT LOUIS THAT PROVIDES VOCATIONAL TRAINING IN SEWING.  CSSM SEEKS SSH FUNDS FOR THE CONSTRUCTION AND PROVISION OF EQUIPMENT FOR A SEWING VOCATIONAL CENTER.
PA NO UNI IS A NONPROFIT COOPERATIVE ESTABLISHED IN 2017 BY A SOUTH DAKOTA UNIVERSITY ALUMNUS. THE PROJECT GOAL IS TO INCREASE LOCAL MANUFACTURING OF AGRICULTURE EQUIPMENT IN GUINEA-BISSAU.
ASSOCIACAO COMUNITARIA MAE JOIA WAS FOUNDED IN 2016 TO HELP THE BOR COMMUNITY DEVELOP A KINDERGARTEN FOR CHILDREN FROM ECONOMICALLY VULNERABLE BACKGROUNDS.

ANCVART-GB SUPPORTS THE CABOXANQUE COMMUNITY IN INCOME-GENERATING AGRICULTURAL ACTIVITIES. THIS PROJECT WILL DECREASE SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC VULNERABILITY OF RICE FARMERS IN THE REGION BY PROVIDING CROP DIVERSIFICATION STRATEGIES.

THE SENEGALESE ASSOCIATION OF MINE VICTIMS (ASVM) WAS FOUNDED IN 1999 BY A GROUP OF LANDMINE SURVIVORS & HAS GROWN TO OVER 400 MEMBERS.  ASVM REPRESENTS NEARLY HALF OF ALL THE LANDMINE SURVIVORS IN SENEGAL & ADVOCATES FOR THE REMOVAL OF LANDMINE.
THE MISSIONARY OBLATES OF MARY IMMACULATE PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE FARMERS OF THE NGUENIENE VILLAGE BY PURCHASING MILLET PROCESSING EQUIPMENT TO MODERNIZE AND IMPROVE GRAIN PROCESSING PRODUCTIVITY.

ASSOCIATION DE DEVELOPPEMENT DU VILLAGE DE NDEUKOU LAMANE WAS FORMED IN 2018.  THE EXISTING HEALTH HUT IS A SUBSTANDARD BUILDING WITH BROKEN BEDS AND INADEQUATE EQUIPMENT.  THIS GRANT WILL SUPPORT PURCHASE OF BASIC SUPPLIES FOR PRIMARY HEALTHCARE.

THE KOULOUCK MBADA PRIMARY SCHOOL IS IN THE KOULOUCK MBADA VILLAGE, MBOUR DEPARTMENT, THIES REGION.  BECAUSE OF THE POVERTY AND INACCESSIBILITY OF THE VILLAGE, ACCESS TO PRIMARY SCHOOLING IN KOULOUCK MBADA IS A GREAT CHALLENGE

THE NOUHA SAMATE ELEMENTARY SCHOOL IN DIAROUME WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1962.  THE EXISTING CLASSROOMS DATE FROM 1949 AND ARE DILAPIDATED WHICH AFFECTS ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE.  THE PROJECT OBJECTIVE IS TO BUILD, RENOVATE, AND FURNISH THE FACILITY'S CLASSROOMS.

THE CENTER FOR RENEWABLE ENERGY AND APPROPRIATE TECHNOLOGY FOR THE ENVIRONMENT (CREATE!) IS AN NGO THAT WORKS WITH VILLAGERS IN SENEGAL.  CREATE! SUPPORTS COMMUNITIES CONFRONT WATER, FOOD, AND FUEL SHORTAGES RESULTING FROM THE IMPACT OF CLIMATE CHANGE.

THE VILLAGE PILOTE AT LAC ROSE IS AN NGO THAT HAS BEEN DEFENDING CHILDREN S RIGHTS SINCE 1994.  VILLAGE PILOTE IS SEEKING FUNDS TO PURCHASE MATERIALS AND EQUIPMENT TO IMPLEMENT ITS YOUTH FARMING PROJECT FOR STREET CHILDREN.
ESTABLISH PIGGERIES TO GROW, BREED, AND SELL LIVE PIGS IN ORDER TO GENERATE LIVELIHOODS FOR THE COMMUNITY OF MAPHUMULO.
ESTABLISH AND OPERATIONALIZE A BAKERY IN WHICH 40 BENEFICIARIES WILL BE TRAINED.
REPLACE EQUIPMENT AND RENOVATE KITCHEN TO INCREASE CAPACITY FOR FOOD PRODUCTION THAT SERVES 900 HOMELESS PEOPLE WEEKLY.

EMPOWER WOMEN WITH DISABILITIES BY PURCHASING MATERIAL AND SUPPLIES TO START A SEWING BUSINESS ACTIVITY. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO FUND AWARENESS ACTIVITIES AND TRAINING IN ENTREPRENEURSHIP, SMALL BUSINESS MANAGEMENT AND SEWING TECHNIQUES.

PROMOTE SOCIAL AND DIGITAL INCLUSION IN THE COMMUNITY BY IMPLEMENTING TRAINING ACTIVITIES IN BASIC COMPUTER AND ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS FOR CHILDREN AND YOUTH. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO FUND FURNITURE AND COMPUTERS TO BE USE BY COMMUNITY MEMBERS.
PROMOTE JOB CREATION AND COASTAL CLEANING BY IMPLEMENTING AWARENESS CAMPAIGNS, CAPACITY BUILDING PROGRAMS, AND PLASTIC COLLECTION AND RECYCLING ACTIVITIES.
PROMOTE INCOME GENERATION IN THE COMMUNITY BY FUNDING THE ACQUISITION OF FISHING MATERIAL, THE REPAIR OF A FISHING BOAT, COMBINED WITH TRAINING ACTIVITIES.
PROMOTE SOCIAL INCLUSION AND QUALITY OF EDUCATION BY SUPPORTING THE ACQUISITION OF FURNITURE AND MATERIAL TO EQUIP A SCHOOL IN A VULNERABLE COMMUNITY.

CONSTRUCT AND EQUIP A FUNCTIONAL AND FLEXIBLE LITERACY CENTER, AND TRAIN WOMEN AND YOUTH TO HELP FIGHT AGAINST VIOLENT EXTREMISM AMONG 10,500 PERSONS IN MAYO MOSKOTA, IN THE FAR NORTH REGION.

THE AMBASSADOR'S SPECIAL SELF HELP PROGRAM PROVIDES SMALL GRANTS TO ASSIST COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS THAT IMPROVE BASIC ECONOMIC OR SOCIAL CONDITIONS IN LOCAL COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF CONGO.

THE AMBASSADOR'S SPECIAL SELF HELP (SSH) PROGRAM PROVIDES SMALL GRANTS TO ASSIST COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS THAT IMPROVE BASIC ECONOMIC OR SOCIAL CONDITIONS IN LOCAL COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF CONGO.
MEDECINS PARTENAIRES HUMANITAIRES IS DRILLING A WELL TO REDUCE WATER-RELATED VULNERABILITY AND PREVENT WATERBORNE DISEASES RELATED TO LACK OF WATER OR USE OF DIRTY WATER IN LUBUMBASHI.
SOCIO-ECONOMIC RECOVERY OF YOUNG PEOPLE THROUGH THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A VOCATIONAL TRAINING CENTER IN CARPENTRY AND SEWING IN THE LOCALITY OF KITSHANGA AND LOCALITY OF PINGA.

DIMR IS CREATING A SHOE MANUFACTURING TRAINING SESSION FOR YOUTHS AND RURAL WOMEN IN KABARE. THE GOAL IS TO SURROUND RURAL YOUTH WITH THE SKILLS AND ABILITY TO CREATE JOBS AND FOR RURAL WOMEN TO HAVE SKILLS TO BECOME FINANCIALLY INDEPENDENT.
REVE KANDALE WILL PURCHASE A 5,00-LITER POLY TANK FORTHE ESTIMATED 28,000 RESIDENTS OF KANDALE TO PROVIDE ACCESSIBLE CLEAN WATER.
FAEVU IS CONSTRUCTING 50 LATRINES TO CLEAN SANITARY FACILITIES FOR THE RURAL COMMUNITY OF BENI. THIS IS A GREAT SERVICE FOR YOUNG GIRLS AND WOMEN DURING THEIR MENSTRUAL CYCLES.

PROMO JEUNE BASKET ACADEMIE WILL BUILD A LOCKER ROOM TO PROVIDE SAFE FACILITIES FOR THEIR YOUTHS TO CHANGE IN, ESPECIALLY THE YOUNG GIRLS. ALSO, TO SAFELY STORE BELONGINGS DURING PRACTICE, TRAINING SESSIONS, OR GAMES.
EQUIPPING THE TRAINING CENTER OF THE LA CASE LANGLOIS IN KINKALA IN SEWING MACHINES HAIRDRESSING HELMETS COMPUTERS, PRINTERS BEDS AND MATTRESSES

CREATING A SEED FARM OF 8.000 M 2 IN THE COMMUNE OF KINKALA. FOR A PERMANENT PRODUCTION AND THE SUPPLY OF MARKET GARDENERS WITH QUALITY SEEDS. ONDV&OC AIMS TO PRODUCE MARKET GARDEN SEEDS OF THE MOST POPULAR LOCAL SPECIES FOR CONSUMERS AND TO PROVIDE A GO

TRAINING YOUNG GIRLS FROM DOLISIE IN THE DEPARTMENT OF NIARI IN THE FIELDS OF CATERING AND MARKET GARDENING. THIS WILL ALLOW THE YOUNG PEOPLE TO GENERATE INCOME AT THE END OF THE TRAINING AND TO TAKE CHARGE OF THEIR OWN LIVES.

CONVERTING YOUNG WOMEN AND MEN WHO PRODUCE CHARCOAL IN HINDA DISTRICT (KOUILOU DEPARTMENT) INTO SMALL LIVESTOCK BREEDERS, TO EMPOWER THEM SOCIALLY AND ECONOMICALLY AND TO PRESERVE THE ECOLOGICALLY VERY FRAGILE FOREST AREAS.

IMPROVING THE INCOME OF THE PEOPLE LIVING IN THE DISTRICT OF MBOMO, IN THE DEPARTMENT OF CUVETTE OUEST THROUGH THE BREEDING OF GOATS TO PRODUCE ANIMALS FOR SLAUGHTER AND TO PROVIDE YOUNG FEMALE BREEDERS TO OTHER FARMERS.
STRENGTHENING THE TRAINING WORKSHOPS BY BUILDING UP A PERMANENT STOCK OF RAW MATERIALS FOR THE SEWING, CARPENTRY AND BASKETRY WORKSHOPS FOR 953 YOUNG STUDENTS FROM BRAZZAVILLE.
IMPROVING THE TRADITIONAL METHODS OF MANUFACTURING CASSAVA BY MODERN TECHNOLOGICAL PROCESSES WHILE PRESERVING ITS INITIAL PROPERTIES OF CASSAVA.
TRAINING AND TO ACCOMPANYING EIGHTY JOBLESS AND VULNERABLE YOUNG PEOPLE OF BRAZZAVILLE IN AGRIBUSINESS (FARMING, RABBIT FARMING, FISH FARMING AND FRUIT DRYING).

THE AMBASSADOR'S SPECIAL SELF HELP PROGRAM PROVIDES SMALL GRANTS TO ASSIST COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS THAT IMPROVE BASIC ECONOMIC OR SOCIAL CONDITIONS IN LOCAL COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF CONGO.
PURCHASE OF MILLING EQUIPMENT FOR CORN, MANIOC AND SWEET POTATOES AND TRAINING IN MANAGEMENT AND SMALL BUSINESS. USE OF THE MILL WILL PROVIDE INCOME AND A SOURCE OF MICRO-CREDIT FOR SMALL BUSINESS.
BUY EQUIPMENT FOR IR. JOSE PAZA MEDICAL CENTER, OPERATED BY NDALATANDO DIOCESE. INCLUDES OFFICE SPACE, A CENTRIFUGE, MICROSCOPES, EQUIPMENT FOR BLOOD COUNTS AND OTHERS.
INSTALLATION AND MAINTENANCE OF FIVE WATER FILTRATION SYSTEMS TO PROVIDE CLEAN WATER IN RURAL CAIONGO COMMUNITIES, WHERE SURFACE WATER SOURCES ARE NOT CLEAN AND HEALTHY.
REHABILITATION OF A COMMUNITY AGRICULTURAL WAREHOUSE IN JENJULA VILLAGE, GANDA MUNICIPALITY, BENGUELA PROVINCE.
THE PROJECT AIMS TO BUILD ONE DAM AND ONE IRRIGATION DITCH IN HUAMBO PROVINCE.
COMBAT CHILD MALNUTRITION. BUILDING OF A JANGO - OR PAVILION - TO HOUSE A FEEDING PROGRAM TO HELP CHILDREN IN CAMANONGUE, MOXICO PROVINCE.
SUPPORT PROGRESS COMMUNITY (BENGO PROVINCE) IN LEVELING SPRING WATER, BUILDING A WELL AND IMPROVING LOCAL SANITATION SYSTEM IN THE SITE BENEFITING 1235 PEOPLE.
TRAIN 640 WOMEN (LUANDA, UIGE) ON ENTREPRENEURSHIP, HR, GENDER ISSUES, PROVIDE VOCATIONAL (SEWING AND MANICURE)AND ADULT LITERACY COURSES.
